alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 24 at 2:27PM EDT until June 24 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL DELAWARE AND SOUTHWESTERN PHILADELPHIA COUNTIES... At 227 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, East Lansdowne, Drexel Hill, Darby Township, Philadelphia International Airport, Morris Park, Tinicum Township, and Broomall. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 10. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 342. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 7. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
